title: Very High Contrast Serif Font - seen in a Magazine
content:
I saw this 'high contrast serif' font in a new glossy magazine.  
After searching and searching (Bodoni's - Didoni - Annlie - Ambroise - Freight Big,...)  
I gave up and turn myself to the experts!

So if anyone has an idea what the name of this font might be,  
I'm all ears!

Thanks, A+

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Afbeelding-10.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119172429/http:/typophile.com/files/Afbeelding-10.jpg) | 172.57 KB |
| [Afbeelding-14.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119172429/http:/typophile.com/files/Afbeelding-14.jpg) | 225.47 KB |
| [Afbeelding-15.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119172429/http:/typophile.com/files/Afbeelding-15.jpg) | 276.52 KB |
| [Afbeelding-16.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119172429/http:/typophile.com/files/Afbeelding-16.jpg) | 271.27 KB |
author: Allison Dh

comments.content: De Vinne and Modern Nº20 are close, but no cigar.

Been here before:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/51703](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119172429/http:/typophile.com/node/51703)  
 [http://typophile.com/node/50616](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119172429/http:/typophile.com/node/50616)

Never identified, probably custom.

Alternative: [Freight Big](http://web.archive.org/web/20141119172429/http:/www.dardenstudio.com/typefaces/freight_big)

I was already afraid that is was custom,...  
to bad. Never the less thanks for helping ;-)  
A+

I must say I like DeVinne!  
A+
Allison, check out also Didot, it is very close on what your looking for
